subject: p13031876
History: -year-old man with ETOH hepatitis, worsening leukocytosis, status post treatment for HCAP. Assess for new infiltrate.
Findings: The right-sided PICC has been repositioned and now ends in the mid SVC. The NG tube courses to the stomach, although the tip is excluded from view. Lung volumes remain low. Retrocardiac opacity persists and is consistent with atelectasis and a small pleural effusion as seen on abdomen/pelvis CT. Pulmonary edema has resolved.
Impression: No evidence of pneumonia. Retrocardiac opacity is consistent with atelectasis and a small pleural effusion as seen on abdomen/pelvis CT.
